text: Castillo de Colomares is a monument, in the form of a castle, dedicated to the life and adventures of Christopher Columbus. It was built near Benalmádena in Spain, between 1987 and 1994. Covering an area of 1,500 meters, it is the largest monument in the world to the explorer, but also contains the smallest church in the world, covering an area of just 1.96 square meters. ==Gallery== File:Castillo de Colomares.jpg File:Troubadour castillo colomares.JPG File:Plaque of Castillo de Colomares.JPG File:Fondateur Chateau colomares BENALMADENA.JPG File:Castillo Monumento Colomares.jpg ==References== ==External Links== * * Category:Castles in Andalusia
